transcript: Prit: every time being extra gap free. So I want to ask both of you, what's your plan, do you want to increase Medicare funding so we won't have to pay extra gap fee or is there any way where we can stop doctors to charge us extra.
Albanese: Well thanks very much Prit for that that question and this is one of my government's priorities.

Albanese: And what we did in last year's budget was we triple the bulk billing incentive for doctors the amount that they pay for concession card holders, for pensioners and others that go along. That resulted in a 90% rate of bulk billing.

Albanese: Now we have another 8 and a half billion dollars to triple the incentive for everyone, all 27 million Australians because we want those bulk billing rates to go up to 90%. On top of that we have Medicare urgent care clinics. There's one just down the road here in Wentworthville that I've been to with
segment_summary: Prit poses a question about Medicare funding and extra gap fees. Albanese responds, saying they triple the bulk billing incentive for doctors and there are Medicare Urgent Care clinics.

key_arguments.argument: They are not to pay extra.
That one of my government's priorities

perspective_commentary.conservative: By showing how the government can lower the fees could help.
perspective_commentary.neutral: Albanese states facts and then he mentions all his points.
perspective_commentary.progressive: The amount of funding will help out in every aspect of medicine.

connections_to_previous_segments: This is just about healthcare so there are no previous relations.
interaction_dynamics: The speaker has a question. The Prime Minister responds about his plan.

notable_quotes.quote: Triple the bulk billing incentive for doctors
notable_quotes.speaker: Albanese

notable_quotes.quote: That one of my government's priorities
notable_quotes.speaker: Albanese

segment_concise_summary: They ask Albanese what is he going to do for people not to pay the medicine gap fee.
